details.title: Three Levels of Kindness
details.content:
1. Chesed from Chochmah â€” giving because one intellectually understands its value.
2. Chesed from emotion â€” giving because one enjoys it.
3. Chesed from Netzach â€” giving with determination, even without understanding or enjoyment. "I will do this no matter what."

details.title: The King's Hidden Treasures
details.content: For routine matters, a king uses his regular budget. But when facing a formidable enemy and needing nitzachon (victory) at all costs, he opens his most hidden treasure vaults â€” wealth no one has ever seen. He would never spend these for ordinary purposes. But for victory â€” everything.

details.title: The Paradox Revealed
details.content: Netzach seems "lower" (below intellect and emotion), yet it reaches the deepest essence â€” the simple will that transcends all faculties. Similarly above: Though Netzach of A"K seems external, it actually draws from the innermost ×¤× ×™××™×•×ª of A"K.

details.title: Avraham's Example
details.content: Avraham's hospitality to idol-worshipping Arabs was Netzach-level kindness. He certainly didn't love idol worshippers, and there was no intellectual pleasure in serving them. Yet he persisted in kindness â€” that's Netzach.

details.content: The orlah doesn't block Atzilut â€” Avraham received prophecy before circumcision! Atzilut's light comes through garments that protect it, ensuring it reaches only proper destinations. But A"K has no garments â€” the kelipot would draw from its exposed light.

details.title: The Eighth Day
details.content: Seven = fullness of creation (7 days, 7 sefirot). Eight = beyond creation. Shabbat is the holiest within the seven. The light of A"K is above this framework entirely â€” hence the eighth day.

details.title: Why Don't Creations Feel G-d?
details.content: Divine light is within everything â€” but the concealing garments hide its source. On Shabbat, these garments become more transparent and we sense the Divine within creation. But even then, it's still internal light working through garments.

details.title: Circumcision is Different
details.content: Milah doesn't draw down light â€” it removes what prevents light from shining. The light of A"K is so lofty that our actions cannot "reach" it. We can only remove the obstacle; then it shines on its own.

details.title: Milah and Priah â€” Two Stages
details.content: Milah (thick skin) removes the barrier to the lower level of A"K. Priah (thin membrane) removes the barrier to the higher, more internal level. For the lower level, even a thin covering doesn't obstruct â€” but for the higher level, even the thinnest barrier must go.

details.title: Why Kareit for Circumcision?
details.content: Only two positive mitzvot carry ×›×¨×ª: circumcision and Pesach. Why? Because these connect to the deepest root of the soul. Neglecting circumcision blocks the soul's ultimate source â€” A"K, "the root of roots."

blocks.title: The Paradox of Netzach
blocks.intro: The attribute of Netzach (Victory/Eternity) appears lowest among the sefirot â€” yet reaches the highest source. This paradox explains why all influence from A"K comes specifically through Netzach.

items.content:
Seemingly lower â€” below intellect and emotion; operates "without reason"
Actually highest â€” reaches deeper than intellect and emotion; draws from the simple will that transcends all structure

For ordinary matters, the king uses his regular treasury. For nitzachon (victory), he opens the hidden vaults â€” wealth accumulated over generations that no one has ever seen. He would never spend these for routine purposes. But for victory â€” everything.

A baby develops some intellect before learning to walk. Yet walking (Netzach-Hod, the "two supports of truth") develops later. Why? Because the ability to walk comes from a deeper root than intellect. What's higher comes later â€” and more externally.

Moshe pleaded: "For it is a stiff-necked people â€” therefore forgive!" Israel's stubbornness reflects their Netzach-level connection â€” persisting in faith even without understanding. This ×§×©×™×•×ª ×¢×•×¨×£ evokes forgiveness from Keter itself.

blocks.outro: The lower manifestation of "beyond reason" corresponds to the higher level of "beyond reason." What appears as obstinacy below is actually connection to the Simple Will above.

items.title: The Lupine Bean
items.body: Rabbi Akiva's answer to the noblewoman: The turmosin (lupine bean) is inedible in its natural state â€” it must be boiled seven times before becoming sweet. G-d deliberately created things requiring human effort to perfect. The difficulty is the point.

items.title: The King's Hidden Treasures
items.body: For routine matters, a king uses his regular budget. But when needing victory at all costs, he opens vaults of wealth accumulated over generations that no one has ever seen. Netzach â€” determination to win â€” unlocks what logic never could.

items.title: The Walking Child
items.body: A baby develops some intellect before learning to walk. Yet walking comes from a deeper root than intellect â€” it develops later precisely because it's higher. What's most essential expresses through what seems most external.
